problem.markdown:
1. Bending stress is the tensile or compressive stress resulting from the application of a non-axial forces
() True (x) False
2. Bending stress is a combination of
() Tensile and shear stress () Compression and shear stress (x) Compressive and tensile stress () Shear and normal stress
3. The section where the stresses are zero is
(x) Neutral axis () Transverse axis () Longitudinal axis () None of these
4. According to bending theory which of the following statement is wrong?
() The plane sections before bending remains plane after bending (x) At the neutral axis of a beam, the bending stress is maximum. () Strain is directly proportional to the distance from the neutral axis. () The bending stress in a beam is inversely proportional to the section modulus
5. In a simple bending theory, one of the assumption is that the material of the beam is isotropic. This assumption means that the
() Normal stress varies linearly in the material (x) Elastic constants are same in all the directions () Normal stress remains constant in all directions () Elastic constants varies linearly in the material
